reviewText: Don't Starve harnesses all of the successful elements of other sandbox survival games and tweeks them to create an atmosphere that is unsettling, urgent, and charming all at the same time. Overall, the game is very well executed. The world the game is set in is at first very brutal, very unforgiving, and there is little-to-none tutorialization. When you eventually start to gain a foothold, the experience can be extremely rewarding. Character perk sets and the ability to customize the world generation and cycles add lots of replay value.
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Second Edit: 26 January 2015
(NOTE: This review is aimed at new players)

So I thought I'd elaborate a little on the context of this game to make this a more useful review like others have made.

First of all, this game is HARD.
Like. REALLY ♥♥♥♥ING HARD.
If you're a newbie at this game, you are going to die ALOT.
But that's not a bad thing.

If there is one thing this game does right its create an atmosphere thats both immersive & chilling.
It is not only a wonderful survival game but an absolutely brilliant adventure game aswell (Once you manage to get to grips with how hard the game can be that is. And you stop dieing as much)
By the way, do you think i'm exaggerating with that You're going to die ALOT" remark?
Trust me
date:
I'm not. Though I really wish I was.

I'll start you off properly by describing the basic mechanics of the game at the start.
First of all
recommended: this game is survival based-so you are gonna have a few things to watch out for when you start up a new game. Health
hoursPlayed: Hunger & Sanity.\nThese are you three basic survival bars which you have to maintain.\nHunger being quenched with food items (raw or cooked)
voteText: and health being quenched also by food
helpfulPercent: but only certain foods. This means that some foods will give you much less health than others (That is that a majority of the food you come across like carrots
votesHelpful:
berries and meat will not heal much)
Health will  regen slowly over time if you cannot afford to waste limited food resources on it though.
And then there's sanity...oh boy.
Sanity is the bar that will quite literally wreck your own sanity in real life if you fail to maintain it.
It can be regained when lost by picking flowers and you can make a hat from the petals you recieve from those flowers which will majorly slow down the rate at which you loose sanity for a few in-game days. If your sanity get's too low though
votesTotal: shadow mosters will start to physically hurt you.\nI will describe enemies a little later in this review. But first
votesFunny:
crafting!

(NOTE: I may re-edit this review another day to describe the crafting in full detail)
Crafting is the most important mechanic in this game and can be a littl complicated for begginers to understand in the beggining.
For most newbies I would suggest the dont starve wiki to get to grips with the different section of the crafting menu
commentsCount:
as describing it here would take me all day.
So onto that description of the enemies!

Enemies come in all shapes and sizes in Don't starve
column16: and they all spawn in the moment you start.\nIt is your job to avoid them until you are ready to take them down...which takes a while.\nMy suggestion is the same as most would suggest
column17: if you're going to attack anything in the first 10 or so days...make it spiders or singled out pigmen.\nIf your sanity gets to low you will not an immense increase in the amount of shadowy creatures lurking about. These creatures will actually be able to hurt you if your sanity gets low enough.\nI won't go into too much more detail about the enemies as you probably get the point
column18:
most are harder to defeat than some.

Now we get to seasons...
When you start a new world you can pick to either start in winter or summer. (FYI. Winter sucks)
After you get through summer you get to autumn
column19: then winter & then it goes back around to spring and then the cycle repears itself
column20:
like real life (not that this game mimics real life cause jesus that would be terrifying)

All in all this game is a terrifying but interesting dark survival experience that never fails to get my blood pumping and my brain on overdrive.

If you are looking for a survival game that isnt a zombie filled gorefest and actually has some genuinly spooky chill-inducing atmosphere and tight survival gameplay
column21:
then this may just be the game for you.

An absolute 10/10

..............................................................................................................................................

First Edit: 29 June 2014

I absolutely love this game.
Survival mixed with dark/horror themes
column22:
your sanity will drain slowly overtime as you encounter strange beasts and dark pits.
Not to mention the countless amount of nights spent in fear of literally EVERYTHING.

10/10"

reviewText:
I wasn't sure if I'd like this game or not initially but I was always interested in it. Now I want to kick myself for not picking it up earlier.

Its a pretty tough game to navigate the first few times, and I'm still trying to survive winter but I get a little closer every time.  I appreciate the fact that once you die the world is gone, but it does discourage me to not play for a day or two afterwords. Once I start it back up though I'm hooked right back in.

Its funny how often things can go completely wrong in this game (I'll just attack that beefalo annnnnnd I'm dead) but adapting to bad situations and managing to survive despite the odds against you is really satisfying.  It almost reminds me of the first time I played Minecrraft survival, except much harder, and also much more rewarding.  This game is good at creating memorable moments and it makes exploring really fun.  Just buy it already.

reviewText: When I think Don't Starve, I think unique. There is truly no game that I have played that is quite like it. True, it's similar to survial games such as Rust but it is... so much more. The game itself is ridiculously challenging, so you'll always be interested in playing it. You can pick from a vaerity of characters (which you have to earn through surviving a certain amount of days with the previous character etc.) which means each playthrough is unique because you need to play to that particular charachters strengths. There are plenty of achievements to keep you entertained too, and the  graphics are clear. However, although I'm sure they will do this in later updates, I personally think there needs to be more crafting options in the crafting menu.\nIn conclusion, it's an excellent, unique game that is well worth buying.\n4.5/5

reviewText:
This game is incredible its just like your basic Sandboxish game with the build and stuff but it also has a legimate adventure mode once you make the diving rod and find maxwells portal anyway
Dont starve has many aspects so you will die eventually (unless you have a crap ton of farms to last you forever)
Plus even if you do die you get xp points so you can get a new character
Dont starve offers a very simple way to install mods like all steam stuff anyway~
And Dont starve never gets old because if you die you still havn't found everything in the game yet.
Another mechanic there is in dont starve is the Sanity system and the being afraid of the dark.
During night or doing other stuff such as picking evil flowers can reduce your sanity and the lower it gets
the more Ghosts you see that want to kill you,At night if you dont have any light around you,then you'll just die cuz of monsters lurking in the dark


Edit: The dlc Reign of giants" is a great addition for hardcore players who tend to find dont starve too easy and are looking for a better challenge

reviewText:
I made fun of my roommate when he bought this game. i had seen it and it looked silly and boring. however, after watching him play for about 5 minutes and asking, What's that?" about a million times i bought it myself. The game is surprisingly addictive. there is more depth to this game than many i have played and it also has a broad appeal. there is humor and strategy evenly mixed with a fair bit of action at intervals just long enough to keep the game from getting boring or repetative. It is both frustrating and rewarding. you will laugh at silly ways you can die after spending hours setting up you camp and smile as you load the next attempt.

Pros:
deep strategy and planning are rewarded

Cons:
where did Thursday go?"

reviewText: On first glance, this might be an average game which turns out to be ok, maybe not a memorable game to be remembered by. The cartoony art-style doesn't make a friendly one, everyone out there is out to kill you, bees to tree monsters to eyeball monsters. Game, always make you come back again and again. reviewText:
This game is really unique and charming.  I particularly recommend it to fans of survival TV shows as it gives you a survival game experience.

In the game, it is a constant struggle to manage your hunger, health and sanity levels.  You are always prioritizing what you need to better your survival situation.  You rarely have time to sit around idle, and are always on the hunt for things you need while fending off occasional attacks from wild hounds or other creatures you come across.

Also, with the addition of Steam Workshop, you can easily tailor the game even more to your liking.

reviewText: This is what I'm talking about. I love games that force you to make hard decisions about what your doing next in it. Don't starve is the perfect example of how games should make you consider almost every action you take. Theres almost no story, no tutorial, and no hand holding. You make the story as you go along. You make life and death decisions every step of the way, and if you mess up? BOOM your dead, game over, please insert two quarters to continue. This is how games should be made. I've faced more indecision and planned farther ahead in this game then Banner Saga, Mass Effect, Dragon Age or any other game that touts its branching storyline". Theres ALMOST no check points
recommended: and no do overs. And If you do manage to figure out how to respawn

reviewText:
At first when I saw this game I never thought much about it. Until one of my friends modded it a few months ago. Now at that time I had no clue on how to mod videogames, and was too lazy to do so. Until a couple of months ago I had tons of free time, and decided to give modding a try. After yet another friend brought this game I was reminded of this game. So since I've been modding 3D games such as Left4Dead2, I decided what the heck, I'll buy this game and give the modding at try.

After playing a none-custom game, I died the first day from not getting up a fire up in time. This made me want to try again, this time I survivaled 3 days, dying by going insane from not knowing how to keep sane. But with each new game I learned how things worked and what creatures are friendly and need to be avioded. After playing it a few hours I have found that this game is INCREDIBLY addicting.

The world randomly generates so every play through is a new experience, keeping each game feeling fresh. You never know when you'll spawn in the middle of nowhere, in a rich in resources pig village, or right next to a spider nest or pack of blood thirsty hounds. Not only that, since I do own Reign of Giants dlc you must watch out for the seasons, if you customize your world settings to be more advanced you may be a unlucky person to spawn in summer or winter, where you can easily overheat or freeze to death. The game is unforgiving, it tries it's hardest to kill you but with each gameplay you learn to survive longer.

The game has a very unique-looking style. It reminds me a little of a Tim Buton-like style, and it's very nice to look at. The creatures are creative too, along with each character you can unlock with their different abilities.

I then tried my hand at modding the game and found that it is VERY easy to mod. Now I do have more experience modding harder games so those without modding experience might take a little longer to learn than someone will some experience, but since the games community and the games staff is generous and very willing to help you with modding it. You'll defiantly get the hang of it eventually. There are also plenty of videos to help you out with it.

I defiantly reccommend buying this game, it is worth every penny. With multiplayer coming out soon you'll be able to enjoy the game with your friends.

reviewText:
Is this game worth £11 you may ask? Silly question, of course! Inclusing the DLC too, this game is a bundle of amazingness. Don't starve is , if not, on it's way to becoming the best gaming experience around. The fact you get dropped into a completely random world full of so many things that can kill you is so much fun. Of course the main objective is to not starve, but there are so many other obstacles to overcome, and so many ways to do just that. Don't starve is an amazing game that has taken up around 100 hours of my time, and soon to be much, much more. It will soon be multiplayer, so being able to experience all the dangers, problems and sucesses but with some company is something to look forward to.
If you do not have patience, then this game probably isn't the best idea. You start off with mainly grass and wood, but as the game flows on, you can be speeding around with a cane, a top hat and some turkey dinner! What could be better?
This game just offers such a thrill. The fact it also has great replayability, with other characters and that you can edit your worlds however you like, making it more difficult or easy, or even install some mods made by the fabulous people in the Steam Don't Starve workshop!
Overall, if you have some spare time, a bit of money and are looking for a good, fun game, then I definately recommend this one.

reviewText: Such a unique game, I've been playing this since the early access days and it was amazing to see how it evolved, this is the way all Early Access should be managed. The game was always highly playable but evolved into a completely different beast as it neared release, constantly adding, improving and refining content so that each update made the game feel fresh.\n\nThere's nothing else on the market quite like it, it's not just the tone and aesthetic that differentiate this from other survival games.  Don't Starve is a unique, fun, highly replayable experience that everybody should try, and hopefully it's only going to be improved by the upcoming multiplayer patch.

reviewText:
I wasn't sure if I'd like this game or not initially but I was always interested in it. Now I want to kick myself for not picking it up earlier.

Its a pretty tough game to navigate the first few times, and I'm still trying to survive winter but I get a little closer every time.  I appreciate the fact that once you die the world is gone, but it does discourage me to not play for a day or two afterwords. Once I start it back up though I'm hooked right back in.

Its funny how often things can go completely wrong in this game (I'll just attack that beefalo annnnnnd I'm dead) but adapting to bad situations and managing to survive despite the odds against you is really satisfying.  It almost reminds me of the first time I played Minecrraft survival, except much harder, and also much more rewarding.  This game is good at creating memorable moments and it makes exploring really fun.  Just buy it already.

reviewText:
The biggest thing I like about this, is that you can never become an untouchable killer - you are always vulnerable so that it stays a survival game no matter how long you play. You can go insane to get killed by creatures of your mind, seemingly harmless animals can kill you in 5 seconds when grouped together, packs of hounds can come out of nowhere, walrus hunting parties will actively seek you out in the winter, you can freeze to death if you don't have warm clothes or fire, the night will kill you, you can starve, trees will come to life randomly, and there is no escape from the dreaded Deerclops.

Lovely music, great art style (demented Dr. Seuss), large emphasis on survival, and a great developer that actively adds new content every month (see: Mojang's dumbassery).

One thing I don't like is that you'll reach a certain point where you'll feel like you've seen and done everything, but this point comes after 80 hours in a single world.

8/10

reviewText:
This game is stunning: the artwork, visual, concept, and the sound. The gameplay is a great sandbox game where you must gather things to craft items and trying to survive. I love minecraft so this one is totally a must have one. I really respect the artwork where it is so gloomy, dark, horror, and thrilling but also funny and cute.

It is an addictive game, especially when you die and learn something new. Once you try this game, you will fell in love with the gameplay and when you know how hard it is to keep your stomach full while being chased by hounds, or when you were trying to keep your self sane when there are no more resource left in your area.

Everything in this game is trying to kill you and you need to survive while keeping your stomach full. The spider will kill you, the hounds will kill you, the were pig will kill you, the tree will kill you, the darkness will kill you, even your shadow will try to kill you when you lost your mind.

Frankly, I am going to miss this game when I am older. Thank you Klei for making this great game.
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Love this; survival in a very real sense - word to the wise, YOU WILL DIE. Don't let it put you off, it's part of the learning process. You should find the game far more entertaining if you don't resort to the wiki for everything and just try to see how you can do each time. Several characters to unlock with very different strengths and weaknesses (and in some cases very unusual abilities)

Randomly generated worlds each time means you have to scout fast and set up shop somewhere with plenty of local resources, you can starve, you can freeze to death, you can poison yourself, you can get attacked by angry wildlife, you can burn to death, get trampled, or eaten. Enjoy :D

Highly recommended!

reviewText:
【好评。佳作。休闲。】
画面风格给8分，卡通但是丰富的画面很有意境，卡通渲染的2D动态画面给很多3D画面审美疲劳的玩家一种怀旧但是也比较清新的感觉。

BGM给7分，音乐比较偏古典西洋系，和游戏主题比较切合，但是音乐听多了其实发现就那么调子不是很多，不过大部分听起来还是可以的。

游戏性给8分，充满丰富自由度和有趣的生存主题让人容易一口气玩很久【“别饿死”这个主题是否会想起贝爷呢~？】，时间流逝系统会让玩家更好理解游戏里主角的目的，多样化的道具合成与材料采集系统也让本游戏充满了RPG要素。

总评：近期小游戏里不可多得的一款优质小品级游戏。

reviewText:
This game.

Gameplay: Don't Stave is a survival game which is a genre that has recently been more prominent in games recently due to the success of some game where you punch rocks and ride pigs? anyway Don't Starve in my opinion stands out among the best survival game I have ever played and thats primarily down to the gameplay as its incredibly fun to explore this tim burton style world and survive its dangers. You have a variety of different characters to unlock that each have their own pros and cons and its that diversity which makes playing Don't Starve different everytime you play.. well that and the world is randomly generated everytime you start a new game! so who knows what you will bump into I am still finding new enemies and items to craft and this is coming from a guy who is 20+ hours into the game. Essentially the gameplay consists of gathering wood, flint, stone and food (which is pretty obvious.. I mean the game is called Don't Starve). There are so many items to craft to improve your camp or camps in the massive world you are dropped into and you get a lot of joy from planning out exactly what you are going to collect and make each time you play but that said the game can be a bit overwhelming for new players as you have to think for yourself rather than the game holding your hand which in my opinion works to the games advantage as it adds a sense of accomplishment when you make something to help you survive and if the game told you how to do most things that feeling would not exist and the game wouldn't be anyway near as entertaining. The gameplay is fun and addicting and also stressful at times but not in a bad way as its not the games fault its your fault for forgetting to make a valid step to survive in this beautiful but dangerous world.

Story: The story doesn't seem to be the main focus of this game but there is a story hidden in there behind each character you unlock as they are all wacky and have a dark sort of wit to them which I love. The basic premise of this game is that you are dropped into a world by the main villian Maxwell and you have to survive and escape (Or just survive for as long as you can for the lols). There are subtle hints dropped by the characters at points in the game about each characters back story which is very nice.

Graphics: This is a beautiful game... its no Skyrim graphical wise but thats not the point this game focuses on art style rather than realism and it works to its advantage as all the characters look like they were taken from concept art by Tim Burton and they are all unique and just as visually interesting as the world of Don't Starve. This is Art.

Overall Verdict: Don't Starve is a great game and I look forward to playing it for years to come and I am also looking very forward to the new game mode Don't Starve Together" which is introducing co-op to the game and I am very interesting in that.

Note: People that hate survival games should at least give this one a chance as this is what got me into the survival genre.

"

reviewText:
IT'S NOT MINECRAFT

The name of the game is really deceiving as starving is one of many ways to die in this game. I'd like to point out here I was expecting something like old Horde game - you stay in a camp, build your defences during the day, defend at night and reap your rewards.

It was not the case as instead the developers gave me a game about survival and exploration. I have to say that second X" part is really crucial for the game
date: as in early stages you will starve or freak out if you don't collect a lot of food
hoursPlayed: some little stones that help you start a campfire. This game makes you watch out not only for your hit points but hunger level and serenity as well. Strange things happen if you become insane.\n\nGameplay also brings you back to point'n'click adventure games where you had to find out what can be combined with what. Here it's similiar

reviewText: I love this game so much already that I decided to play it for about six hours and then drop by just to leave a good review. This game is like a twisted combination of a survival and adventure game, yet every time you play it you get a completely different experience that is definitely worth your time. There are so many different things going on in this game that it's a bit overwhelming at first, but there is a bit of a learning curve and it all gets easier after the first hour or two of gameplay. If you are at all hesitant about purchasing this game, do yourself a favor and buy it now.

reviewText:
Character - days survived - cause of premature demise
First - 0 - darkness
Second - 1 - spider
Third - 1 - tophat ( via spider )
Fourth - 16 - walled myself in... unaware of hammer ( i am forcing myself to play without the wiki xD )i lit the wall on fire and perished amidst the ashes of my own folly.
Fifth - 19 - I was doing well, i thought. It was time. Off i set upon my grand adventure. Setup my secondary base, swiftly assaulted by trees that sprung to life in the pitch black mire of night. Two days later, ( still on the run from those persistent angry trees ) I discovered a gigantic dense, dark forest. On the brink of being consumed by inconsistencies within reality assaulting my mind, near starvation. I Fling myself with bestial vigor at the forest, igniting all that i can see. That will teach those blasted trees! As i step back to admire my handiwork and enjoy the warmth of this impromptu bonfire i equip my spear and armor, for good measure. Suddenly from behind a long viscous tendril rips my spear from my grasp! I whirl around, only to find myself facing a small horde of particularly evil looking ... frogs... FROGS!!!! I try to run only to find more. As my armor is swiftly snatched from me as well; In desperation i flail at the slimy foes with my hatchet. As poor wilson was slowly drowned under the foul smelling bulk of god knows how many of these depraved creatures; i could hear his last dying gasp.... He said in a barely audible gurgle of pain  Why did it have to be frogs...... " and perished.

TL:DR JUST GO AHEAD AND GIVE THEM YOUR MONEY ALREADY
date: its worth it. I promise xD\n\n10/10 would get mauled to death by froggers deliquent cousin again."

reviewText:
Don't Starve... A game in which you think you are on top of the world, a game in which you think your powerful becasue you can burn things, because all of nature is at your disposal. You can make crock pots, drying racks, and refrigerators to brave the elements, you can dodge tentacles, fight monsters and burn tree monsters. You can destroy beehives, slaughter bees, bunnies, and pigs. You can fight giant deer like monsters which with a fatal swing, you can munch on their eyeball. Only to be taken down by your own inability to digest cooked mushrooms. At it's roots, a beautiful game about survival. But be warned will make you rage harder than that one time you let that one D-bag cheat off your test and he got a better grade than you.

The game also features a variety of charachters such as a man who doesnt immediately seem to have any buffs but later in the game can be the greatest of all for his neutrality and the fact that beard hair can be more important for a prolonged game than weaponry. His name is Wilson.

A young lady who again doesnt seem to have too many buffs aside from the fact that she carries a lighter. However, this lighter is not only convienient but raises this girls sanity tremendously when lit. Her name? Willow.

A strongman likely hailing from the circus. When on a full belly crushes monsters with few hits. When hungry becomes a lanky being incapable of throwing a punch. A strongman named Wolfgang.

A lady who doesn't seem to be anything worth taking a second look at, but when her flower blooms, she is accompanied by her ghostly sibling named Abigail who kills anything and everything. I present, Wendy.

A robot that is weakened by the rain and superpowerd by lightning. A robot who upgrades all of his stats by swallowing gears and a robot whom doesn't give a ♥♥♥♥ about the state of his meal. WX-78

An old hag librarian who seems to have insomnia and an inability to digest food that is stale or beginning to go bad. At first she may seem like the worst charachter of all, but she has a secret... she can self publish books of power which give extremely strong buffs to the player. She is Wickerbottom.

And finally (or is he?) a Canadian lumberjack who seems to be a pretty nice guy and arguably some of the best stats in the game. But he has a terrible secret linked to his origin and his beloved Axe.

All those charachters with their wide ranges of personality, chat, buffs, and nerfs. But there are still two more that you, as the player need to unlock. Goodluck and godspeed because the world of Don't Starve is not something to bat an eye at.

12/10 Amazing

reviewText: A very good survival game.  Choose a character, each with their own little quirks and dialogue.  Explore the world, harvest food and supplies, build camps, survive attacks, discover and create crazy new things, survive the night and the hardships that come with each season, rinse and repeat.  There's good enemy variety and lots of things to discover, and you have a good amount of customization for the world before you spawn in it.  Everything from frequency of the various enemy/food spawns, to how the seasons work.\n\nThe game also comes with a Caves update (probably big enough to be a DLC) that adds an entire new biome, enemies and more, and also a mod that adds an entire other little game called The Screecher.  The DLC Reign of Giants is also worth getting, it adds quite a bit of content for it's price.  Over all, a great game.

reviewText: This game is a very detailed and complex game that starts out with you waking up and this man pops out of the ground. He tells you to look for some food before nightfall so, you take his advice and get up off the ground in search of flint, food, etc. It seems so simple yet it is so complex! there are many characters in the game that you DO NOT NEED TO BUY! They are all unlocked by survivng and gaining XP. This game is a very addictive game that keeps you coming back! There are also mods like Wulfe, Easter Eggs, and Bigger Stacks (my reccomendations). Check this game out and get the Reign Of Giants DLC, its really cool! So, overall, this game is a fantasy-based game that feels like Minecraft and Terraria but in a 3-D world with more things to craft, much more things to do, and many other fantasy creatures out to get you like Hounds, Tallbirds, Spiders, etc. So, check this game out! And are you good enough to not Starve?

BGM给7分，音乐比较偏古典西洋系，和游戏主题比较切合，但是音乐听多了其实发现就那么调子不是很多，不过大部分听起来还是可以的。

游戏性给8分，充满丰富自由度和有趣的生存主题让人容易一口气玩很久【“别饿死”这个主题是否会想起贝爷呢~？】，时间流逝系统会让玩家更好理解游戏里主角的目的，多样化的道具合成与材料采集系统也让本游戏充满了RPG要素。

总评：近期小游戏里不可多得的一款优质小品级游戏。

The name of the game is really deceiving as starving is one of many ways to die in this game. I'd like to point out here I was expecting something like old Horde game - you stay in a camp, build your defences during the day, defend at night and reap your rewards.

It was not the case as instead the developers gave me a game about survival and exploration. I have to say that second X" part is really crucial for the game

reviewText: I absolutely love this game. You get thrown into the world with absolutely no real tutorials, just the challenge to try to not starve to death, or die from insanity. A tutorial is honeslty not needed though. You can quickly learn the basics through trial and error, exploring new combinations of actions. The ui layout is simple, you have various characters to choose from and even a short minimod available if you choose, which is awesome even for how short it is. I originally saw this on a game stream a friend was watching and had to play it. I am not sure if this still works, but I was able to take my game key and register it within a chrome app so I can even play quick games in my chrome browser at no extra cost. Amazing replay value.

reviewText:
(Experience: unlocked 7 out of 9 characters)
(Time spent: 22 hours at the moment)
(Bought price: Gift from friend)

Don't Starve - and its DLC Reign of Giants - is a spectacular survival game that definitely nails the 'see-how-long-you-can-survive' aspect. The amount of craftable stuff keeps every run fresh and fun. This includes: weapons and armour to fend off monsters, firepit and crock pot to cook your meals, science machine and lightning rod to extend your survivability, and so much more!

This is a game that tests how well you budget your time, Each day consists of a day and night cycle. By day, you can harvest food and materials but by the time night comes around you'll find yourself having to cook enough food to feed your stomache. And, if you manage to survive your first day, you get to repeat the whole process all over again, and thus, it tests how long you can live as long as you Don't Starve.

Bottomline: This is a game that you should ABSOLUTELY try out, if just to see why it is so popular among many fans.

reviewText:
Don't starve is 2d survival game with a gorgeous art style that looks like Tim Burton movies have turned into cartoons. There is a sandbox mode, where you try to survive as long as you can, as well as an adventure mode with a minimal story. There is also a wide variety of crafting (as well as cooking) which is neatly organized into different tiers.

While the game's purpose is quite simple -not to starve- you get no handholding whatsoever. Your character is stranded in an unknown world, where you need to figure out what to do in order to survive. This can result in several deaths initially, as well as loads of hilarious situations which inevitably occur when you run around poking things. Don't starve is mostly unforgiving to your mistakes -which can end in permanent death- but rewards you with unlocking several characters with unique abilities, in order to spice up your gameplay. There is an option to tweak several world aspects as well, if you are looking for a more casual sandbox experience. I should also mention there are constant updates and a workshop community for this game.

Definitely recommend it, if all the above are your cup of tea :)
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Is this game worth £11 you may ask? Silly question, of course! Inclusing the DLC too, this game is a bundle of amazingness. Don't starve is , if not, on it's way to becoming the best gaming experience around. The fact you get dropped into a completely random world full of so many things that can kill you is so much fun. Of course the main objective is to not starve, but there are so many other obstacles to overcome, and so many ways to do just that. Don't starve is an amazing game that has taken up around 100 hours of my time, and soon to be much, much more. It will soon be multiplayer, so being able to experience all the dangers, problems and sucesses but with some company is something to look forward to.
If you do not have patience, then this game probably isn't the best idea. You start off with mainly grass and wood, but as the game flows on, you can be speeding around with a cane, a top hat and some turkey dinner! What could be better?
This game just offers such a thrill. The fact it also has great replayability, with other characters and that you can edit your worlds however you like, making it more difficult or easy, or even install some mods made by the fabulous people in the Steam Don't Starve workshop!
Overall, if you have some spare time, a bit of money and are looking for a good, fun game, then I definately recommend this one.

reviewText: At first I had thought Don't Starve would be easy, but I soon found out I was way wrong when a tree suddenly turned into a giant monster and murdered me on Day 17. I honestly was not expecting that. That bad experience was not in vain, though. Now I know in my future lives not to chop trees at dawn (seriously, don't). This is a good example of how you must learn from your experiences in order to do well in this game. The only way to succeed is by trial and error, and although it can be extremely frustrating when you lose everything, that is kind of what makes the game fun; knowing such a fate is possible puts you on edge. Also, the mod support is amazing. Getting new mods is literally 3 clicks away, and you can then easily enable/disable them from a convenient menu at the main screen. This is truely a great survival game so buy it if you're in to that kind of stuff, and good luck.

reviewText: So easy to be sucked in by the simple story and gameplay that finds a clever way to nudge you in the right direction.\nHarsh difficulty curve, if you don't have light on the first day,you die instantly.Resarch of how to survive the first night is recomended however once you get the hang of what you need to do and how to do it you will be set.The game also offers up an adventure mode,which you can explore once you find Maxwells door.This offers up five different chapters you must traverse in order to advance.This is also used to unlock what will probably be the last two characters in the game.And that's another thing,there is a wide range of choices for characters,each with their perks and their downfalls,while I prefer Wendy if you're having trouble with the night portions,Willows lighter wil suffice as a light source.Overall the game is amazing,few games have absorbed me as much as this,I like to call it a much more refined and detailed minecraft,so people used to playing that game will feel right at home with the crafting system and dangerous nights.\n9/10

reviewText: I strongly recommend this game.  Reminds me of Minecraft's first few minutes/hours where you're scraping to stay alive, but this is harder, and more rewarding, minus the building for the most part.  The art style is great, very atmospheric and fun to watch.  Though no in-game instruction is given, the difficulty of picking up on how things work isn't bad, after a couple deaths, you'll know how to progress through the first few days.\n\nThat's my one gripe, dying starts you over, with no save game, it automatically deletes it for you.  This lends urgency to your quest to survive, which I like, but the first 3 days or so take half an hour, and there's not much variation in during that time, so it starts to feel a little repetitive.  But after that, there's tons of cool stuff, so it's a minor annoyance.  Also, to be fair, I wouldn't have to play those first three days so many times if I'd just follow the direction, Don't Starve""

reviewText: Don't Starve harnesses all of the successful elements of other sandbox survival games and tweeks them to create an atmosphere that is unsettling, urgent, and charming all at the same time. Overall, the game is very well executed. The world the game is set in is at first very brutal, very unforgiving, and there is little-to-none tutorialization. When you eventually start to gain a foothold, the experience can be extremely rewarding. Character perk sets and the ability to customize the world generation and cycles add lots of replay value.

reviewText:
This game is amazing. The style is incredibly cool, the music is great, and the gameplay even better. I cannot find the words to accurately summarise the level of awesome Don't Starve is, it's just absolutely brilliant, in so many ways. As you get no tutorial, no hints (apart from the obvious - don't starve!), it is a game of figuring stuff out at first, and there are so many things to expore, find, and craft! Seeing as you can customise just about everything in your world before you start a game, there are endless possibilities when it comes to difficulty, and not to mention, the dreaded Adventure mode which will make you want to gouge your eyes out with a rusty spoon and throw them at the treeguards while you scream with the fury of a thousand suns.

If you like survival, base building, hillarious puns, exploring, crafting, and not having a game tell you exactly what to do at all times - Don't Starve is for you. 10/10 in my book!

...Apart from the treeguards. F*** you, treeguards.

reviewText: I don't know of too many survival games that are more rewarding than Don't Starve. You are given the tools to scavenge and hunt and naturally discover new crafting options. reviewText:
The biggest thing I like about this, is that you can never become an untouchable killer - you are always vulnerable so that it stays a survival game no matter how long you play. You can go insane to get killed by creatures of your mind, seemingly harmless animals can kill you in 5 seconds when grouped together, packs of hounds can come out of nowhere, walrus hunting parties will actively seek you out in the winter, you can freeze to death if you don't have warm clothes or fire, the night will kill you, you can starve, trees will come to life randomly, and there is no escape from the dreaded Deerclops.

Lovely music, great art style (demented Dr. Seuss), large emphasis on survival, and a great developer that actively adds new content every month (see: Mojang's dumbassery).

One thing I don't like is that you'll reach a certain point where you'll feel like you've seen and done everything, but this point comes after 80 hours in a single world.

8/10

reviewText: Such a unique game, I've been playing this since the early access days and it was amazing to see how it evolved, this is the way all Early Access should be managed. The game was always highly playable but evolved into a completely different beast as it neared release, constantly adding, improving and refining content so that each update made the game feel fresh.\n\nThere's nothing else on the market quite like it, it's not just the tone and aesthetic that differentiate this from other survival games.  Don't Starve is a unique, fun, highly replayable experience that everybody should try, and hopefully it's only going to be improved by the upcoming multiplayer patch.

reviewText:
I wasn't sure if I'd like this game or not initially but I was always interested in it. Now I want to kick myself for not picking it up earlier.

Its a pretty tough game to navigate the first few times, and I'm still trying to survive winter but I get a little closer every time.  I appreciate the fact that once you die the world is gone, but it does discourage me to not play for a day or two afterwords. Once I start it back up though I'm hooked right back in.

Its funny how often things can go completely wrong in this game (I'll just attack that beefalo annnnnnd I'm dead) but adapting to bad situations and managing to survive despite the odds against you is really satisfying.  It almost reminds me of the first time I played Minecrraft survival, except much harder, and also much more rewarding.  This game is good at creating memorable moments and it makes exploring really fun.  Just buy it already.

reviewText: I've always liked survival games. They are rare, very rare to come upon on. The game is sort of like other survival games like Minecraft. reviewText:
Don't Starve is a top down 2D survival game! As the player you are dropped into the middle of a wilderness as Wilson (you unlock more characters as you play and survive for longer) and must survive by gathering resources, crafting and fighting monsters as well as your sanity.

The art style is incredibly unique and I'm very fond of the gothic look and feel it has. The gameplay is very easy to gain an understanding of, you simply point and click to pick up resources and click to interact with the world. But the difficulty comes when as the days progress and you come face to face with more challenging environments and creatures that don't like what you do.

Thing is, in Don't Starve, when you manage to kill certain creatures or you manage to survive past a certain amount of time, you feel like you've really accomplished something. For example, by killing Beefalo, which are incredibly tough very early on you will get great resources for future use which can help you go on for much much longer!

This game will constantly frustrate you at the beginning, but learning the game is massively rewarding!

reviewText:
Very good survival game.

A little bit hard at first, especially if you are rushing the monsters or forget to make
a fire at night... and if you die, the game is over (except if you got some special item)

You can die from the monsters, of starving ... by your own imagination and ... the dark.
When your sanity is low, you start to see things than don't exist... or maybe they
really exist?
One thing is sure, if your sanity is low enough, they became material and can kill you...
Fear the dark. The night monster (also named Charlie) what you...
If you are in the complete darkness, he will catch and kill you... (pretty fast)
At thte dusk, be sure to have what you need to make a fire and do it before the
night.

After 21 days, the winter come...
the bees stop doing honey and the farm stop too...
the berry bushes, tree sampling and the Grass Tufts grow extremely slowly.
Some new creatures start to spawn and... you can freeze.
Having warm clothing slow it down but be careful...
There is some dangerous area and you should go there only if ready...

-the Marsh:
tentacle monster and hostile Merm... also the tree and the bushes make dammage when you pick them.

-cave:
More dangerous than the Marsh, always in the dark...
A lot of new creature (hostile most of them) and stuff...
Be REALLY careful.

-Ruin:
Below the cave...
More monsters, illusion even sane... you are dead if you go there.

There is also a portal, somewhere where you can do a challenge...

reviewText: You're dropped into a world with no tutorial, no narration, no guidebook.  Simply click on things, find out what they do, combine them with other things, and LEARN.  This game is brilliant in its simplicity and depth.  With each death, you learn a little bit more about how to survive for longer.  My only complaint is that once you figure out how to survive, the game can stagnate and become rather dull.  Sure, you can make up your own endgame goals, but I wish there was better endgame content.

reviewText:
One day, My brother showed me this cool game, Don't Starve. I was quite interested in getting this game and after buying it and playing it for a while, I got addicted to it!

I recommend this game to be played because to me it's an EPIC survival game. It has great graphics, Great gameplay, and really easy controls. Its best suited for survival game lovers like me.

But yet, be careful when you play this game, There is a ton to monsters to fight. One wrong move and you might end up getting a one way ticket to DEATH.

Good luck and remember....
Don't Starve.

reviewText:
I read one review which said minecraft + Tim Burton + pain. I'd say this is pretty accurate. I dont think it was quite mentioned in the game description but if you die, then the game stops - you have some methods of resurrection but you have to be really careful in this game! :D

You will die many times before you start to get the hang of things. I've played 50 hours before I even decided to start Adventure mode..... so I thought I was going to find it quite easy to begin with. How wrong I was....

I like this game for its difficulty and the random quotes you get when examining stuff! I wasn't expecting much, but it really is fun.

Update @111hrs

I can still easily spend all day playing this game and I still haven't mastered it! Half the time Im just fighting for survival that I can't get to explore the caves and stuff. Haha I guess I'm just bad at the game although I have managed to survive a few 100+ day games..

I don't think my review does the game justice. Its definitely great fun but hella challenging

reviewText:
General Review:

Amazing game, very intuitive and diverse. The graphics are very cool and dark and the sound effects are simply amazing. If you like games where you need to craft things in order to survive you will love Don't Starve. And for those who think don't starving is pretty easy, well think again, there are a lot of things that will try to kill you besides your hunger.

Pros:

-Very Challenging
-Adventure Mode is fun
-Lots of craftables
-Cool bosses"
-Sandbox mode is infinite

Cons:

-Map is kinda confusing
-You cannot write your signs
date:
just put them on the ground
-The 2Dish graphics along with the 3D camera shift may give you a hard time placing things where you actually want them to be
-Some resources do not respawn and therefore will no longer be avaliable when you harvest them all

What could they do to make it better?

-Provide better ways to locate yourself and your items
-The map should have the option to show a specific item or material according to filters
-Make rocks respawn (the underground provides rocks but it's far too dangerous)
-Develop a better way to turn the camera around"

reviewText: You're dropped into a world with no tutorial, no narration, no guidebook.  Simply click on things, find out what they do, combine them with other things, and LEARN.  This game is brilliant in its simplicity and depth.  With each death, you learn a little bit more about how to survive for longer.  My only complaint is that once you figure out how to survive, the game can stagnate and become rather dull.  Sure, you can make up your own endgame goals, but I wish there was better endgame content.

reviewText:
This game is about survival. You need to find food, resources, build your shelter, don't get ♥♥♥♥♥ by monsters, explore and so on.

Gameplay - 7.5/10
Graphics - 4/10 (But the art style is awesome)
StoryLine  - 2/10

This game is very cool *BUT* it's unforgiving as hell! No respawn if you die and you lose all of your stuff. Basicly you need to start a new game.

Overall I'll rate this game a 7/10 :)
